Detailed Description

Class that models a form object from the chisimba core modules.

It basically an interface class between the hosportal module and the chisimba core modules. This creates less dependancy on chisimba and increases flexibility and maintainability. This form object lets you add numerous different types of objects and fields. Once you have inputted all the data required in those objects. You can set this form to be submitted. Once submitted, all the inputted data is converted into parameters in which you can use the string query function getParam(variable to be stored,parameter) to do what you like with them in other entities.

Author:
Salman Noor

Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this class

Member Function Documentation

addObjectToForm ( $  object_to_be_added  ) 

Member function to allow you to add whatever object you want inside it.

Parameters:
object_to_be_added It can be any variable type. Once added it will be displayed wtihin the form. Examples would be objects like links, text areas,drop downs, icons, buttons and even normal strings.
Returns:
A beefed up form object that is ready to be displayed and submitted.

Returns a member function from the form class of the chisimba core modules.

If you call this method without any arguments, you would not be adding anything.

Definition at line 69 of file form_module_class_inc.php.

createNewObjectFromModule ( $  name_of_form = 'messages',
$  form_action = NULL 
)

Creates an object from the chisimba core modules.

Parameters:
name_of_form A string with default value set to messages.
form_action The variable tpye can be a string or an url array default as null. Once the form is submitted, it will do what the variable form action is set to do.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
A new form object to be used.

Return an new empty form object to add other objects inside it.

init (  ) 

Standard constructor that sets up one object of this class.

If the class you want to use is in another module, then you have to load that class from the specific module.

Definition at line 37 of file form_module_class_inc.php.

showBuiltForm (  ) 

Method to display the form with all its added elements.

Returns:
A member function from the form class of the chisimba core modules.

Once the form object has been completely modelled, this can allow you to display it.

Field Documentation

$objform [private]

Private data member of class form_module that stores an object of another class.

This class is composed of one object from the form class in the html elements core module of chisimba. This object models one form object.
